page.title: 06LIVESTOCK FARMING
page.content: LIVESTOCK FARMING The stud which is a public stud has been in operation since 197O. There are three stallions standing at present. The stud and farm comprises about fifty stables and about 1OO mares per season visit from all parts of the country. Once the mares are in foal they return to their owners and return two weeks before the foal is due. The mare when safely delivered will come into season about ten days later and will be covered by the chosen stallion. Once pregnancy is confirmed the mare will return once more to its owners. At the height of the foaling season the hours worked are long and sometimes arduous. The farm uses the hay it produces to feed the horses and straw is purchased locally.
